Abyssinian: expressive face with a slightly concave profile.
almond-shaped eyes, usually green or gold
short, fine coat with a distinctive "ticked" pattern
Bengal: coat colors often in shades of brown, gold, or snow (white)
short coat with distinctive spotted or marbled patterns
large almond-shaped eyes, usually green or gold
Birman: White "gloves" on the front paws and "laces" on the back paws
Stocky build with a broad head
Color-pointed coat (darker coloration on ears, face, paws, and tail)
British Shorthair: Large, round eyes, often copper or gold in color
Egyptian Mau: hind legs longer than the front legs, giving a "tippy-toe" appearance
distinctive coat pattern with spots scattered randomly across the body
Maine Coon: Polydactyl paws (extra toes) in some individuals
Prominent ruff of fur around the neck
Ragdoll: Pointed color pattern, often with colors like seal, blue, chocolate, or lilac
Floppy and relaxed posture when held
american pit bull terrier: ears that can be cropped or natural (half-prick or rose-shaped)
beagle: distinctive vocalizations like howling and baying
large, expressive brown or hazel eyes
boxer: possibly wearing headgear (in some training or amateur contexts)
chihuahua: proportionally large head in comparison to its body
english cocker spaniel: Common coat colors: black, liver, red, golden, or combinations including roan and particolor markings
english setter: well-proportioned body with a lean, athletic build
coat colors typically white with speckles of black, blue, lemon, orange, or brown
tail that feathers and tapers to a point
german shorthaired: Long, floppy ears that hang close to the head
Coat color is typically liver (brown), liver and white, or liver roan
great pyrenees: Primarily white fur, though may have gray, badger, reddish-brown, or tan markings
Strong, muscular legs adapted for working and guarding livestock
havanese: plume-like tail that curls over the back
various coat colors including white, black, grey, and brown
japanese chin: Plumed tail carried over the back
Feathered, V-shaped ears that drop down
keeshond: dense mane of fur around the neck and shoulders
bushy tail that curls over the back
leonberger: coat colors typically include lion-yellow, golden, red, red-brown, and sandy
strong and broad head with a slightly domed forehead
medium-length ears that hang close to the head
newfoundland: Broad head with a strong and rounded skull
Small, dark eyes that are set deep into the face
pomeranian: Color variations including orange, black, white, blue, brown, cream, and more
A plumed tail that curls over the back
pug: smooth, short coat, typically fawn or black
saint bernard: Broad head with a pronounced stop
Distinctive reddish-brown "mask" around the eyes and ears
samoyed: a smiling expression, often referred to as the "Sammy smile"
scottish terrier: Distinctive, wiry coat, often black, but can also be brindle or wheaten
Dark, almond-shaped eyes with a keen expression
shiba inu: curled tail that usually rests over its back
white fur on the chest, legs, and tip of the tail
staffordshire bull terrier: Broad head with pronounced cheek muscles
Tail that is low set and tapers to a point, often described as "pump handle" in shape
Distinct stop (where the forehead and the muzzle meet)
wheaten terrier: floppy ears that hang close to the head
a tail that is typically held upright or slightly curved
yorkshire terrier: often has a topknot or hair tied up on the head
compact body with a straight back
